page.title: 17Recent History-Gosmore contd
page.content: "During the 1950's the Parks was meadow-land with cows and horses.They grazed on the lush grass and butter- cups, daisies and mushrooms.They used to stand under our oak tree with their heads over the back fence.Once they broke through one of the fences and trampled all over the gardens in Priory Way! "Many elm trees died in the area a few years ago and a number of old oaks have been chopped down too. "In ancient times, the Park was a Roman market and old coins are often found even today.The oak tree is over 400 years old. "35 years ago,Charlton was quite different with a very old public house and old cottages opposite.These have been pulled down to make a car-park. The lane to Charlton was just a cart track until about 15 years ago".
